titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jennie Langthorne school certificates 1977.483
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-11-30 21:26:58 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Miss Whitcomb's French, English, and German Day School for Young Ladies and Children

did.abstract: Two 1884 certificates issued to Jennie Langthorne by Miss Whitcomb's Seminary in Brooklyn, N.Y.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The two items in this collection are housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Jennie Langthorne school certificates, 1977.483, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two certificates issued to Jennie Langthorne for penmanship and the completion of a course of study by Miss Whitcomb's Seminary (formally called Miss Whitcomb's French, English, and German Day School for Young Ladies and Children), located at 191 Clinton Street in Brooklyn, N.Y. Both documents are dated June 9, 1884.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
